items.title: Two new governors bring hope for US moderate left ahead of midterms
items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani's win in New York City wasn't the only victory for Democrats this early November. Left-wing women candidates also won in key governor races in Virginia and New Jersey, giving cause for optimism for the Democrats ahead of next year's midterm elections. The winners, a former Navy helicopter pilot and a former CIA officer, won by focusing their campaign on economic arguments.
items.content: Zohran Mamdani's win in New York City wasn't the only victory for Democrats this early November. Left-wing women candidates also won in key governor races in Virginia and New Jersey, giving cause for optimism for the Democrats ahead of next year's midterm elections. The winners, a former Navy helicopter pilot and a former CIA officer, won by focusing their campaign on economic arguments.

items.title: Japan deploys the military to counter a surge in bear attacks
Japan deploys soldiers to contain surge in bear attacks in Akita
items.standfirst: Close encounters reported almost daily as bears intrude into residential areas and attack and sometimes kill peopleJapan has deployed troops to the northern prefecture of Akita to help contain a surge in the number of bear attacks that have terrorised people in the mountainous region.Unexpected encounters with bears are being reported almost daily in the lead up to hibernation season as the animals forage for food. The bears have been roaming near schools, train stations, supermarkets and even at a hot springs resort. Continue reading...
items.content: Close encounters reported almost daily as bears intrude into residential areas and attack and sometimes kill peopleJapan has deployed troops to the northern prefecture of Akita to help contain a surge in the number of bear attacks that have terrorised people in the mountainous region.Unexpected encounters with bears are being reported almost daily in the lead up to hibernation season as the animals forage for food. The bears have been roaming near schools, train stations, supermarkets and even at a hot springs resort. Continue reading...

items.title: Besieged by bears, Japan deploys troops to combat record wave of deadly attacks
items.standfirst: Japan’s military deployed troops on Wednesday to the country’s northern prefecture of Akita in response to a surge of bear attacks killing at least a record 13 people this year.
items.content: Japan’s military deployed troops on Wednesday to the country’s northern prefecture of Akita in response to a surge of bear attacks killing at least a record 13 people this year.

items.content: Japan has deployed troops to tackle a surge in bear attacks, which have killed a record number of people since April.

At least 13 people have died from bear attacks this year.

items.title: Shein: Opens first permanent store in Paris as scandal and criticism mount
items.standfirst: Despite administrative sanctions and an ongoing judicial investigation into the sale of child-like sex dolls, the Asian e-commerce giant opened its first permanent physical store in the world at the BHV on Wednesday.
items.content: Despite administrative sanctions and an ongoing judicial investigation into the sale of child-like sex dolls, the Asian e-commerce giant opened its first permanent physical store in the world at the BHV on Wednesday.

items.content: The economy ministry said proceedings would last until Shein proved all of its content complied with French law.

items.title: Why does Shein draw such contrasting feelings? A look at France
items.standfirst: Shein opened its first-ever permanent shop on November 5 at the prestigious BHV department store in Paris, drawing protesters and bargain hunters amid controversy over the Chinese online fast-fashion retailer's low-cost business model and its impact on the French high street and manufacturers.
items.content: Shein opened its first-ever permanent shop on November 5 at the prestigious BHV department store in Paris, drawing protesters and bargain hunters amid controversy over the Chinese online fast-fashion retailer's low-cost business model and its impact on the French high street and manufacturers.

items.title: France moves to suspend Shein over sex dolls as debut store opens in Paris
items.standfirst: The fast-fashion retailer has faced a backlash after the childlike dolls were discovered for sale on its websiteThe French government has said it will suspend the fast-fashion shopping website Shein amid controversy over its sale of childlike sex dolls.The announcement came as Shein opened its first brick-and-mortar store in the world in Paris amid a heavy police presence. Continue reading...
items.content: The fast-fashion retailer has faced a backlash after the childlike dolls were discovered for sale on its websiteThe French government has said it will suspend the fast-fashion shopping website Shein amid controversy over its sale of childlike sex dolls.The announcement came as Shein opened its first brick-and-mortar store in the world in Paris amid a heavy police presence. Continue reading...

items.title: France Seeks Shein Suspension on Sex Doll, Weapon Complaints
items.standfirst: The French government said it would temporarily suspend the Chinese e-commerce giant Shein, just hours after it opened its first store in Paris, following complaints over sales of childlike sex dolls and weapons on its platform.
items.content: The French government said it would temporarily suspend the Chinese e-commerce giant Shein, just hours after it opened its first store in Paris, following complaints over sales of childlike sex dolls and weapons on its platform.

items.title: France moves to suspend Shein amid sex dolls controversy as Paris store opens
items.standfirst: France has initiated proceedings to suspend online fast-fashion retailer Shein until it complies with French laws and regulations, the finance ministry said on Wednesday, just hours after crowds of shoppers – and protesters – turned out for the opening of the Asian e-commerce giant's first Paris store.
items.content: France has initiated proceedings to suspend online fast-fashion retailer Shein until it complies with French laws and regulations, the finance ministry said on Wednesday, just hours after crowds of shoppers – and protesters – turned out for the opening of the Asian e-commerce giant's first Paris store.

ai_summary: France is considering suspending the Shein website.
The action follows complaints about the sale of sex dolls.
Shein opened its first permanent store in Paris.
The store opening drew both protesters and shoppers.
The French government is investigating Shein's content compliance.

items.title: Philippines begins cleanup after Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves dozens dead
items.standfirst: Residents of the central Philippines on November 5 began scraping mud from streets and homes that survived after Typhoon Kalmaegi killed at least 85 and left dozens missing as it tore through the region. The devastating aftermath sparked anger among many Filipinos who say public officials have mismanaged funds in phantom flood safety projects.
items.content: Residents of the central Philippines on November 5 began scraping mud from streets and homes that survived after Typhoon Kalmaegi killed at least 85 and left dozens missing as it tore through the region. The devastating aftermath sparked anger among many Filipinos who say public officials have mismanaged funds in phantom flood safety projects.

items.title: Hegseth announces another deadly US strike on alleged drug boat
items.standfirst: Pentagon secretary says two people killed in attack on boat in eastern Pacific, bringing total killed to 66 in 16 strikesThe US defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, announced yet another deadly strike on a boat accused of ferrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean, coming the same day an aircraft carrier began heading to the region in a new expansion of military firepower.The attack on Tuesday killed two people aboard the vessel, Hegseth said, bringing the death toll from the Trump administration’s campaign in South American waters up to at least 66 people in at least 16 strikes. Continue reading...
items.content: Pentagon secretary says two people killed in attack on boat in eastern Pacific, bringing total killed to 66 in 16 strikesThe US defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, announced yet another deadly strike on a boat accused of ferrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean, coming the same day an aircraft carrier began heading to the region in a new expansion of military firepower.The attack on Tuesday killed two people aboard the vessel, Hegseth said, bringing the death toll from the Trump administration’s campaign in South American waters up to at least 66 people in at least 16 strikes. Continue reading...

ai_summary: U.S. forces conducted another strike on an alleged drug vessel.

clusters.title: 'The mess my life became is not unique': Diary collection wins prestigious non-fiction prize

items.title: 'The mess my life became is not unique': Diary collection wins prestigious non-fiction prize
items.standfirst: A writer, whose "candid" and "unsparing" diaries have become the first to ever win the prestigious Baillie Gifford Prize for Non-Fiction. has told Sky News she is "delighted" to see the literary format recognised rather than dismissed.
items.content: A writer, whose "candid" and "unsparing" diaries have become the first to ever win the prestigious Baillie Gifford Prize for Non-Fiction. has told Sky News she is "delighted" to see the literary format recognised rather than dismissed.

items.title: 'Addictive' diaries win prestigious non-fiction prize
items.standfirst: Helen Garner's How to End a Story: Collected Diaries is first diary to win Baillie Gifford prize.
items.content: Helen Garner's How to End a Story: Collected Diaries is first diary to win Baillie Gifford prize.

ai_summary: Helen Garner's diaries won the Baillie Gifford Prize for Non-Fiction.
The diaries are the first diary to win the prestigious award.
The author expressed delight at the recognition of the format.
The diaries are described as candid and unsparing.
The diaries are considered "addictive" by some reviewers.
